isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - TROUBLESHOOTING - "YELLOW" OIL/WATER WARNING LIGHT (CHECK ENGINE LIGHT)

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to paragraphs Yellow "Oil/Water" Warning Light for description of circuit operation.

svcsubproc.title: "Yellow" Oil/Water Warning Light Does Not Turn ON
svcsubproc.para: This test should be performed if the light does not turn ON during the self test.

para.emph: Before beginning this test procedure, inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires etc. (Refer to paragraph Visual Inspection Inspecting Connectors.)

svcsubproc.para:
(Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.07 or 6.10
, for this test.)

svcsubproc.title: "Yellow" Oil/Water Warning Light Stays ON or Comes ON Intermittently
svcsubproc.para: This test should be performed if the light stays ON or comes ON intermittently.

step1.para: If the light comes on intermittently, check for logged codes, because the light comes on briefly while codes are active.
If the complaint is related to the light continually flashing diagnostic codes (without operator prompting), The Cruise Set/Resume Switch circuit may be shorted to ground.

para.emph: Before beginning this test procedure, inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires etc. (Refer to paragraph Visual Inspection Inspecting Connectors.)

svcsubproc.para:
(Refer to
CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS, Figure 6.07 or 6.10
, for this test.)

note.para: Disconnecting (558) from the ECM will cause incremental amounts of Trip Data to be lost. An "Event Recorder Data Lost" code may also be logged. The loss of this data will not affect engine operation, but will affect the accuracy of the data. Ask the owner/operator if they want data recorded before disconnecting.
